This is a base project created for learning and experimenting with Android development using Kotlin. It includes a variety of examples and best practices to help you get started with building Android applications!
Asynchronous programming is handled using Kotlin Coroutines and Flow, providing a straightforward way to manage background tasks
Utilizes Material Design components for a modern and visually appealing UI.Includes extensions for common tasks to enhance productivity.

Currently an engineering student in the third year at the National School of Engineers of Le Mans, I am looking for a final year internship, for a duration of 6 months, which can start from the first of March. Passionate about mobile development and good programming practices, I want to focus my career in this field.
\n\n Swipe up for more

Slink - available on PlayStore
 A mobile application used to:
 - Create and share your own link library.
 - Like and comment.
 - Get notifications for actions performed by other users.

MCA student in computer science\n Looking for a high paying job.

MotionLayout is a layout type that helps you manage motion and widget animation in your app. MotionLayout is a subclass of ConstraintLayout and builds upon its rich layout capabilities. As part of the ConstraintLayout library, MotionLayout is available as a support library and is backwards-compatible to API level 14. This project is a simple example of MotionLayout usage.
